snippet: The XP-819 is a one-of-a-kind Corvette developed as a research vehicle by General Motors in the 1960s. The car is now being brought back to life at a restoration shop on Long Island.
abstract: XP-819, one-of-a-kind Chevrolet Corvette developed as research vehicle by General Motors in 1960s, is being brought back to life at restoration shop on Long Island.
lead_paragraph: The XP-819 is a one-of-a-kind Corvette developed as a research vehicle by General Motors in the 1960s. The car is now being brought back to life at a restoration shop on Long Island.

headline.seo: The Rear-Engine Corvette That Was Never to Be
